text: Bottle pour at home, brought this back from Lakeview liquors in Chicago. Black pour almost no head. Bourbon aroma little sweet smooth flavor little licorice rosted coffee and some coco.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

341ml bottled on 2012-10-02, 4 years old. Pour dark brownish with reddish reflexion. No foam and look inert. Signs of the beginning of maderisation and notes of bourbon barrel. The taste is strong on the bourbon side. Alcohol is also pretty in your face. Big warm feel. Long finish of spirit. Better on taste than the aroma. Low carbonation and high body. 6-2-9-3-17 Yeah, 17, just because its well aged and it taste great.

Pretty solid Belgian Strong Ale with just enough bourbon barrel notes to round it off. Yeah a tad sweet and lush but that is the point methinks. Has aged nicely, bought at West Lakeview Liquors since it was brewed for their anniversary a few years back.

Aromas a Malta a fruta madura, ciruelas, bourbon, licor
Buen aspecto con poca carbónatacion
Se nota el alcohol en boca, muy maltosa, sabor a pasas y ciruelas. También barricA
Plena en boca

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. No date, bourbon barrel aged. Very dark brown. Aroma is dark fruits, candied sugar. Slight oaky spirit. Taste is oak bourbon. Belgian candied sugar. Sweetness plays perfect with the bourbon. Very smooth. 


This stuff is really delicious.

Bottle - Murky dark brown colour, large creamy tan head, good retention and lacing. Fruity and roasty nose, raisins, dates, cocoa powder, toasted nut, caramel, plum. Taste is sweet and bitter, dried fruits, caramel, raisins, a touch of tobacco and oak. Full body, soft carbonation, velvety texture, bittersweet finish. Beautifully complex malty strong ale, worth trying.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a Trappist glass. Dark brown with light brown highlights, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is bourbon, wood, vanilla, and some dark fruit. I would probably like this better with more carbonation.

From tap. Dark copper brown color with beige head. Malty aroma, caramel, chocolate, fruits, dark dried fruits, vanilla, wood, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Almost full oily body with soft carbonation.

Constatation 1: " Mince yapadbulles "
Constatation 2: " Mince yapurien dans le verre "

Dégustée en regardant "les fraises sauvages" de Bergman ( Chic, nest ce pas ? ). La preuve que lon peut faire de véritables bonnes bières sans mettre du piment ... Vraie belle complexité du vieillissement, ainsi quune grande longueur en bouche. Joli design intriguant. Un délice donc, devant un très beau film. Une belle soirée ...
Bebida en cimmeria, muy rica y sorprendente, cerveza con gran cuerpo y espuma consistente.

Murky ruby brown, decent tan ringed pillow. Nose is inky coconut, rich brass vanilla and loose brown sugar. Decent enough thick, rich dark cherry and stalky sugar with a real vibrant barrell buzz. Theres viscosity and theres a buzz - mouthfeel is what sells this to me. Sails the linger a long, long way into the sunset. Finishes like a bunch of raisins have been leeching on the wood, linger is peppery and sherry sweet with more dark fruit burn. The swooping balance did this all for me, everything lined up and the sweetness was something wizardry.Bottle, Sir Tadalot Top 50 Scottish Tasting
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head, Slightly roasty aroma, dried fruits. Taste of dried fruits, roasty. Sweet and a little hot.
Pours a purple brown with a slight brown head. Aroma is tablet, bourbon and vanilla. Taste is raisins, figs, red grapes, caramel, toffee and some slight alco heat.

Tomada en Cerveceria Kraken. Potentisima imperial stout. Muy alicorada, sin espuma.
Sabor muy potente a bourbon.
Para degustar con paciencia y disfrutar.

Bottle. Deep dark pruney fruity nose. Thin brown color, flat. Condensed prunes and raisins, rich and pleasant, a hit of light tobacco,. Fruity sweeness rules the mid palate and final. Medium-heavy body. Great flavors, not overdone.
Bottle. Cloudy brown with lace. Nose is caramel, raisins, spicy yeast, plums. Spicy, slightly tart flavor, caramel, cola, steak sauce, brown sugar. Like an aged quad. Nice.

Collaboration brew, a barrel aged stout with rye. Sticky, dense, creamy, stable, yellowish wite head over a very dark burgundy beer, almost black. Strong aroma of tawny port, marzipan, milk chocolate, rye bread, bourbon, basil, candied orange, banana, coffee powder, black olives, brown rhum, cooked meat, vanilla and mocha ice cream. Densely sweet, praline-like onset, banana and marzipan again, deep rye sourishness throughout the palate with even somewhat drying effect, very thick and fat chocolatey and caramelly maltiness, umami taste blending in with the sweetness and sourishness, finishing dryly sourish, lightly bittering from roasted malts, very woody (tannins), umami touch, warming alcohol. Another interesting Molen creation, though perhaps not as appealing to my personal taste as some of their other stouts.
This poured a lighter brown with a beige head. Aroma was of Bourbon, booze, and dark fruits. Flavor was ok barrel, light Belgian dark underneath but a lingering booze burn.

Bottle. Pours a viscous black oily body barely producing any bubbles or head. Aroma of dates and raisins along with caramel and bourbon. Taste is thick caramelly bourbon riding on a thin carpet of lightly sour woody notes. Hints of leather, liquorice and balsamic vinegar. Vinous port notes as well. Full bodied and very softly carbonated.

27-MAR-2014, bottle @Papsø clear all tasting, @Amager Bryghus with Ulkløbben.
Hazy dark Brown with a low tan head.
Chocolate, bread, Bourbon, Vanilla. All about the malts. Full body, average carbonation. This is fantastic. I really enjoyed this.

12 oz. bottle thanks to Adrien. Aroma is a healthy dose Belgian yeast with light chocolate, molasses and maybe even a light berry hint. Flavor shows a light oak upfront with milk chocolate hints in the center with the yeast showing up strong in the finish. Secondary notes of dark fruit and sugar. 
The ABV is hidden really well but this bottle has sat for a good amount of time. The carbonation level is lower with a soft mouthfeel. This has a nice flavor but the bottle was extremely over priced at $9.00 for a 12 oz.
Bottle at home, 7th February 15. Pours fairly clean and dark, slightly see through. Aroma, vanilla, bourbon, molasses. Taste is sweet, vanilla, oak barrel, bourbon, candy, molasses. Pretty tasty.

Bottle from a friend. Strong and complex smell with caramel, bourbon, oak and dried fruit. Similar taste. Qutie sweet which balance out the booze from the barrel. The barrel gives it a very nice complex touch with lots of oak, vanilla and bourbon. Almost no carbonation but that is a plus in my book.

botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 31/01/2015.
Color negro, Carbonatacion baja, Aromas a licor. cuerpo denso

Bottle thanks to charule. Pours a murky maroon brown. No head. Aromas of vanilla, candies dark fruits, butterscotch. Taste is sweet with a nice bourbon alcohol heat. Medium body and light carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is toffee, vanilla, caramel, sugary, light fruit, taste is rich caramel, dark fruit, sweet, toffee.

(De Molen / Närke Goths & Vandals ) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 10.6%
Black coloured beer, small brown head with good retention, minimal lacing left behind.
Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, very appealling.
Taste of bourbon, alcohol, vanilla, light wood, dark fruits.
Medium thick body, soft carbonation.
Very good.

330ml bottle @Cimmeia, Oviedo. 17-12-2014.
BBD: need to check, but was in date for long.
In short: tasty barley wine?.
Pours very dark with little tan head. Short head retetnion, poor lacing. Malty, caramel, liquor, sweet honey aromas. MEdium body, flat carbonation, viscous texture. Taste is quite malty, sweet, plums, raisins, some roasty notes. Warming mouthfeel, liquor profiled. No hints of aging noticed, but still an impressive strong dark ale, verysmooth and enjoyable.
Pitch black. Vanilla bourbon aroma. Taste is bourbon choco vanilla and some coffee. Full body. Lovely-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle thanks to Eric. A huge brew. Pours a dark brown color with a very small white head. A sweet bready nose, toast, candy. Really this is a lot like a big sweet Doppel. Raisins, toffee, pine, huge dark bread. Sugary sweet, caramel. Damn good. Roasted/burnt caramel. This will get you.

Murky, very dark brown. Small offwhite head. Aroma has dried fruit, alcohol, raisins and plums, leathery brown sugar. Flavour has warming alcohol, dried fruit, figs and plums. Well balanced bitterness andsherry-sweetness. Malty, boozy finish. Certainly one of the best at the Vollerup Space Race Advent Rating.

Bottle, 10.6%. Sweet and bready aroma, some raisin and dark dark brown sugar. Cloudy dark brown colour, hint of red - or is it the christmas table cloth? Very small light brown head. The flavour is very sweet with a good dose of vanilla. Late dried fruit notes with more vanilla and a good bitterness to balance. Also has a little bit of fruity sourness, reminds me of cherry, to balance.

Bottle @ Hoppy Advent Race in Space, Sønderborg. Pours murky light coffee brown with small beige head. Clear aroma of malt, caramel and fruit, with faint touches of coffee. Sweetish flavour of caramel malt, milk chocolate, lactose and barrel. Mild bitter notes. Sweetish aftertaste. Warming alcohol presence. Very nice. More like a Quadrupel than a BSA but very good, nonetheless.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, thanks a ton Matt! Dark thick brownish black pour with thin off white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma brings candied fruit, dark caramel, toffee, nice dark fruit, some chocolate, sweet vanilla, bourbon, and oaky notes. Taste had a mix of sweet dark fruit, oak, bourbon, nice caramel, molasses notes into a hint of spice, finishing sweet, toffee and honey. Tasty, but wish it was a bit more balanced.
OMG OMG OMG NARKE! Mediocre at best. Tastes like a much worse Pannepot. Some raisiny sweetness, floral yeastyness, candy sugar, and finishes a bit chemically. I dont hate it but man nothing special.

From a 33 cl bottle shared at home after Thanksgiving dinner. Pours a clear copper with a thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate and vanilla. Flavors of caramel and dark fruits. Slightly sweet, boozy finish.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma bourbon, vanilla, sweet, caramel, chocolate, raisin, berries, dark fruits, molasses. 
Taste vanilla caramel chocolate sweets, some berry sour, little bitter. 
Mouthfeel thick, oily, sticky. 
Awesome beer, more imp. stout.
oddly sweet. Not much for barrel characteristics. not much for smokiness either, its like they forgot the hops and the rest of the stuff. bland. and cloying.

Pours deep mahogany into a tulip. Tan head quickly recedes to hug rim. Dark caramel and bourbon aromas. Soft with sweet caramel and oak upfront turning to hot bourbon and vanilla in the lasting finish.

330. Pours a murky, near-opaque dark brown with very little head or lace. Big rich raisiny nose, showing deep caramel malts, toffee, brown sugar, smells almost like a sweeter old ale. Very complex malt notes shining through, plus a plummy, raisiny yeast character (or maybe the raisins are special b). Creamy thick sticky body, soft carb. Dense heavy caramel, toffee, treacle, raisins, and plums on the mid palate. Lovely. Long sticky sweet finish.
Bottle from Casanova filled almost to the lid. Poured dark translucent brown with no head. Aroma full of boozy raisin and prunes. Pretty much no carb. Taste similar to aroma light bourbon.
Draft->snifter at Churchkey. Dark reddish-brown with offwhite ring. Caramel, molasses, cocoa, booze. Strong.

As Goths & Vandals Barrel Aged, at 10.6%. Poured dark reddish brown with a tan ring. Aroma of vinous berries, dark roast malt and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour is sweet berries, much of the aroma, light coffee. Belgian strong my arse, halfway between an imperial stout and a barley wine.

Botella de 33 cl se 1420 tomada el 11-10-2014 en el momento en llamas. Embotellada el 28-02-2013 para 25 años. Color negro intenso con espuma beige oscura poco persistente. Sabores y aromas de maltas tostadas con cacao y café y buena dosis de madera empapada en bourbon, algo dulce y especiada. cuerpo medio de 10,6 vol con gran sensación de licor y ligero paso por boca. Bastante buena, intenso sabor de bourbon.
From a 330ml brown bottle. Dark brown colour, no head. Rich nose with caramel, brown sugar, licorice. Taste has brown sugar, bit of roast, booze. Caramel and boozy finish. Enjoyable and rich.

Bottle shared by Ferris, thanks man! Dark brown boozy looking pour with no head. Aroma is very port like, kind of like boozy rum soaked raisins. Taste is brown sugar, caramel, no carbonation, sticky sweet mouthfeel with a mild boozy finish.
Molasses, caramel, cocoa, booze, and carrot. Sludgey brown with a thin smattering off white head. Molasses, caramel, gourd, coffee, and mocha.
Bottle - Lots of caramel and booze with a touch of cocoa. Murky brown with a decent beige. Booze, molasses, cocoa and lots of toffee. Much like a Barleywine.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2015 Bottle in hotel room bodegraven 2014... Deep black... Thin tan lacing... Deep honey... Sweet toffee.. Light licorice nose.... Soft sweet meaty malts... Soft sweet toffee... Beefy 
 bottle at home ... June 2015 ... deep brown ... thin tan lacing ... soft meaty toffee malt nose ... soft swet honey toffee fruit malts ... bitter herbal toffee 3.2

A Ratebeer.com általi besorolást alapul véve hagytam magam meggyőzni arról, hogy egy "belgian strong ale"-t tartok a kezemben egészen addig, míg az első kortyot követően elbizonytalanodva forgattam meg ismét a címkét némi megerősítést keresve ahhoz a sugallathoz, mely szerint ennek a sörnek a legtöbb porcikája leginkább az imperial stout-műfaj felé húz. S mivelhogy remélhetőleg a gyártók maguk hitelesebbek lehetnek e téren, én jóhiszeműen rájuk hagyatkoznék a kategorizálást illetően. Annál is inkább, mert az egyik legkülönlegesebb imperial stoutról beszélek, amit alkalmam nyílt megkóstolni pályafutásom során. Bár közepesen áttetsző, kóla színű teste ezt nem feltétlenül vetíti előre, illata egy lépéssel közelebb visz minket a Kánaánhoz. Fantasztikus, enyhén tőzegfüstös nyitányú, krémes, tejszínes, vaníliás-kókuszos, mazsolás aromák járják ezerszínű táncukat; a legszebben megkomponált whiskyk illata tárul elénk. A fenti komponensek aztán egy arcpirítóan édes, likőrös testben találnak ránk ismét; vibráló és izgalmas ízjegyek sokasága tűnik fel egy cukorközpontú, ám malátásan is telt keretben, majd gyógynövénylikőrös keserűséggel búcsúzik a kompozíció, amit az alkohol melege jár át jótékonyan. Csukott szemmel kóstolva gond nélkül vágnánk rá, hogy miféle itallal van dolgunk, a körítés azonban valóban kissé kérdésessé tesz mindenféle tipológiai iránymutatást. Ez legyen azonban a legnagyobb problémánk, ha egy ilyen főzettel akadunk össze, nálam mindenesetre előkelő helyet foglal el a tesztalanyok népes táborában.
sweet nuts and light alcoholic aroma,brown, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, long finish,
Dark brown coloured. Has an off-white head, mostly diminishing. heavy sweet and winy aroma, sugars and faint vanilla. Flavor starts heavy sweet, warming alcohol, more vanilla. Faint acid too.

In bottle; pours dark brown black with a little little brown head. Aroma of oak and bourbon. Taste is medium bodied, with the bourbon notes along with some fruit notes .. alcohol definitely there .. this one was OK, not great

A pitch black colored beer, with a small beige head. The aroma of vanilla, wood, some chocolat and alcohol notes. The taste is full of flavors, like the vanilla, wood, dark roasted malt and alcohol. The aftertaste stays for a long time in your mouth with at last the burning alcohol. Beautiful beer.

11.2oz bottle. Guess this is semi-officially my first from Närke finally. Was just thinking about what that smelled like...a big barleywine! YUM. Plummy and raisiny nose with hints of sweet roast and Belgisugars. More dark fruits up front which moves into a lot of burnt apple, a hint of smoke and booze, with a sweet barleywine finish thats sugary. Thick! DANK.

Black bodied, stable small head. Vanilla, wood, tobacco, Belgian yeast sourdough bread. But thats only the beginning. Huge taste, concentrated, smooth dark malts, almost yoghurt mouth feel. Unctuous, sticky, rich. A fine, fine beer to celebrate my 3500th rating! (33cl bottle from SpeciaalBierPakket I belief)
Bottle at Paradiso Dupont. Hazy maroon amber color, flat. Big vanilla, bourbon, burnt caramel aroma. Taste is strong vanilla and caramel candy, light spice. Complex and delicious.
Bottle. Chocolate malt, dry grass, alcohol aroma. Dark brown with small head. Sweet chocolate malt, moderately bitter herbal and alcohol flavor. Tasty.

330 ML bottle
Thanks to Jeffo and Owen for this

Dark mahogany color, bottle filled to the top. Thank you De Molen. Light brown head, one finger in height. Yay, carbonation. 
Massive bourbon and dark fruit nose. Figs, dates, dark cherries, and brown sugar. Lots of booze in the nose. 
Taste is like the nose. Lots of booze, bourbon, oak, and dark fruits. Low carbonation and big feel. Rich and chewy beer. Nice though

Bottle:
Dark, cloudy brown with a tan ring.
Caramel, raisin, vanilla malt aroma.
Flavour is surprisingly tart (at first sip) chocolate/whiskey/wood....
dark fruits, molasses.
Boozy, creamy and dark.
Flat, but thick...dark woody bitter.
Excellent.....but ridiculously priced.
Aroma of caramel and candy. Taste is caramel candy, lots of sugar, moderate alcohol thats well balanced, very good.

How: Bottle.
Where: De Molen Beershop, had at SMÖD.
Appearance: Dark brown, almost black, colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Whiskey, dried fruit, plum, raisin, sweet malt, alcohol.
Body: Medium body and carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel.
Flavour: Dried fruit, raisin, plum, sweet syrup, some alcohol.
Dark brown colour. Sour bourbon and dark fruits aroma. Taste is sweet, bourbon, vanilla, oak, plums

[Bottle] Opens with no hiss and the bottle is filled almost to the cap. Pours dark brown with no head. Another flat De Molen beer? Shocking. Oh well, it actually kind of works with this one. Aroma is pineapple, raspberry, lots of barrel--coconut, milk chocolate, and caramel. Really hot in the taste. Lots of barrel. Medium mouthfeel, flat, decent length finish. Overall, decent, but not even remotely worth the price. I had stopped buying De Molen after the last overpriced beer fiasco, but I bought this one because of Narke. I wont make that mistake with De Molen again.

Bottle at Torst. Dark brown pour with red tints and a fleeting off white head. Caramel malt and cherry bouquet. Complex with caramel malts, dark fruits, booze, oak, and vanilla highlights. Good body and mouthfeel.

from Erzbierschof - clear ruby-brown beer with no foam left; aroma of molasses, Portwine, prunes and alcohol, hints of soy sauce; full-bodied, some strong malt sweetness, chewy and thick; the finish is salty, malty with more notes of molasses, ripe red fruits and a solid alcohol presence - robust stuff

Pitch black with a minimal tan head. Aroma: bourbon, vanilla, oak, bit too much of alcohol. Taste: very sweet and bourbony, soft and sweet finish, no bitterness present, but again quite a lot of alcohol. Mouthfeel: velvety, warming. Nice beer, but the alcohol is a bit too overpowering in my opinion.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 A lot of bourbon, caramel sweetness, but still not that sweet. Its quite light, and has a very weak roast, a lot of caramel malt flavor, but without the sweetness. Licorice, raisin, bourbon, booze. Not that carbonated.
Bottle at Mikkeller&Friends. Pours flat red/brown. Aroma is figs, alcoholic, oak, plumbs burnt raspberry. Taste is sweet date, alcoholic, oak, roasted malt. Really nice

Pours dark brown shaded with burgundy. Looks fairly clear but its on the dark side, almost hard to tell. Very small head. Khaki bubbles. Just a scattered few after the initial pour. The aroma has a lot of caramel sweetness. Some bubblegum, not too bad. Mild toasty doughiness. Some stone fruit, really not much for a quad, though. Fairly medicinal. Not terribly spicy. More caramel sugariness. The taste is awfully sweet. Theres a lot of caramel, sweet nondescript fruitiness, bubblegum, some medicinal character. Sticky. Slick mouthfeel. Not too much carbonation. Heavy. Not really all that great. Lots of funny sweetness, not enough spice.

Bottle shared with popery. 
Aroma is full of raisin, fig and prune with a lot of caramel, toffee and burnt sugar. Some low alcohol notes. Quite a bit of Belgian yeast character. 
Pours brown with some ruby and burnt amber color. Small, thin tan head immediately recedes to the edges. 
Flavor is fairly sweet with a lot of caramel, toffee and burnt sugar. Lots of raisin, fig and prune. Tons of burnt sugar mid palate. An odd, slightly medicinal cherry note with medium bitterness in the finish. Moderate alcohol. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium low carbonation. Low, but present astringency with medium alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright beer that gets better as it warms up, but the burnt sugar note is way too strong for me and combines with the fruit esters to take on a medicinal quality.

33 cl bottle (10,6%) @ hotel room, Amsterdam. Bottled on 28.02.2013, BBE 28.02.2038
Aroma has sweet cocoa notes and salty licorice. Also a sweet feeling of bourbon  which I didnt notice before I knew this was BA stuff. Flavour has alcohol, salty licorice, some bourbon-like vanilla and tobacco. A tad too sweet but I like it how this warms my throat. A bourbon juice, but still a positive surprise after all and nice slow sipper.

Pours a deep dark ruby amber color on the edges but appears black without being backlit. Thin film of khaki foam. Nose is pretty inviting with rich caramel, sweet bourbon, butterscotch, boozy dark fruit ad a hint of earthy leather. The palate follows and is really nice, with a smooth silky mouthfeel. Big layered flavors yet still quite balanced. Sweet boozy bitter. Yum !

Bottle from the Brewery at Borefts Beer Festival 2013, at Camping As Cancelas a campsite in Santiago de Compostela, Galicia, Spain, Saturday 21st June 2014.   Pours jet black with beige head (btw before I even start Liz absolutely loves this) bourbon is well integrated I hate it when its overdone, its spot on here. Aa Loz suggests quite rightly this floats in your mouth, it just hangs there you get a little burn but not too much. The nose is assertive there is some heavily alcohol soaked prunes, dates & raisins it really has a boozy but fruity nose and a touch woody. Lovely and soft in mouth, thick a little salty liquorice but mostly dark fruity. Love this.  A8 A4 T9 P4 Ov17 4.2
Bottle. Dark brune pour with tan head. Sweet caramel and dark malt aromas, touch of alcohol tones. Roasted dry flavors with caramel, and chocolate sweet influences. Finish has a bit of warmth.

Smooth, caramel notes, very full bodied with mild carbonation. Wonderful bourbon character on the nose and throughout each sip. A quite unique quad . will definitely seek it out again. I bet the guy who gave the 1.4 rating just opened a dud, no way a person knowledgeable of worldly beer could give a rating that low unless the bottle was corrupted. Try it again and enjoy.
Aroma is caramel, mild nuttiness and malts. The flavor is caramel/toffee, malts, fruit, medium sweetness and a mildly sour/warming alcohol finish.

11.2 oz bottle from Party Source. Pours a clear dark brown color with reddishhighlights and a thin ring of beige bubbles. The lack of carbonation is evident. The aroma and flavor have big dark fruits, raisins, figs, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, cherry, some yeast. Syrupy mouthfeel, the flavor is sweet, but good. The lack of carbonation doesnt hurt this as much as it would a sour.

0,33 l bottle as a gift.
Deep dark body with a small lacing beige head. Aroma of cherries, bourbon and wood, tobacco and leathet. Strong, killer character in the flavor. Almond, cherries with tobacco, vanilla and bourbon, leather. Fine!

New Beer Distributors, NYC 11.2oz ($8): Pours murky brown with a small tan head that completely disappears after a bit. Aroma is bourbon and vanilla. Taste is strong whiskey bite that sits around for a bit. I guess the hops add a strange underlying bitterness. Really heavy and somewhat cloying aftertaste. Plenty of fruity flavors involved trying to sneak in under the whiskey. This beer is powerful and is a sipper for those who have acquired the taste. As the person who gave this a 1.4 said, a beer noob could drink this and be discouraged from ever having another beer. All in all, this is powerful and roasty stuff. I am not sure whether I really like it, but I can respect it.
At proletariat with my dad. Pours flat murky red mud brown. Aroma is big fig, some bourbon, figs plumbs burnt raspberry. Taste is sweet fig, bourbon, interesting malt.

11.2oz bottle, from Party Source. Imported by Shelton Bros. Labeled 10%. This is probably the most full-to-the-top bottle I have ever seen, ever. The liquid level was actually above that ridge in the glass, just below the cap lip. Unfortunately, that didnt seem to help preserve the beer. The beer is flat as hell. Goddamnit Party Source, this is the second time you have screwed me over in one night. Something is obviously wrong the moment I pour this... Very little head, just a minimal ring of khaki head is evident moments after I pour. No lace. Head soon fades to absolutely nothing. Murky brown color, which is a little unsettling, because I thought this was going to be a stout. Not that its bad that this is a barrel-aged dark strong, its just a bit misleading. The label is a mess and hard to read, but screams "imperial stout" from first, second, and third glance. On the 4th glance at the label I notice a nearly illegible text under the portrait on the label that reads simply "ale aged in bourbon barrels". Doh, silly me, how could I have not known this was going to be a belgian dark strong ale? Flavor isnt horrible... Pretty cloying sweet, kind of yeasty though. Medium to bigger body. Flat texture. More dry finish. Along with the sweet taste, theres a big bite and heat in the finish. Flavor is a lot of caramel malt, some dark fruit, bruised mushy grapes, Light bit of smokiness, some bourbon quality. Ahh, fuck. Might be good if it wasnt just flat thick syrup. That quality makes this undrinkable. Couldnt even finish half. De Molen, Shelton, [2nd tier distributor], and Party Source... You are all guilty here. Get your shit together. If someone that was relatively new to craft beer took a gamble on this and bought it for $10, they would quit craft beer forever and resent the entire scene. Is that what you want? To ruin the industry? Why even do I keep falling for this BS? I stopped buying movie tickets after I felt ripped off for the umpteenth time... Maybe I wont be so gullible next time I see a product like this. For the sake of your own longevity bite the bullet and invest in a little quality control.

Bottled. Full 33cl sample. The aroma has caramel, roast, dark fresh fruits, bourbon and vanilla. Black coloured beer with a very thin head. The taste is slightly bitter, has malty sweetness and a nice hint of fruity sourness, probably from barrel. There is bourbon, roast, chocolate and fruitiness. Medium-full bodied. Nice.
Brown dark with beige head that dissappears. Aroma: wood and alcohol. Taste: wood at the beginning, but chocolate, vanilla and coffee in the end.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dark brown/black color with a thin diminishing tan head. Aroma/flavor is a complex mixture of roasted malts, dark dried fruits, berries, caramel, syrup, chocolate, vanilla, Bourbon and wooden nuances on the palate. Great smooth mouthfeel. Great beer.

Bottle (thanks to Papsø) shared with Niller - dark brown nearly black with a reddish hue, and a very thin diminishing tan head. Aroma and taste is complex with mixture of dark roasted malts, both dark dried and berry fruits, caramel, syrup, choc, vanilla, cherry, lovely bourbon and wooden nuances on the palate, smooth warming but not overt boozy, great mouthfeel. Exquisite.

(Bottle, Arendsnest, Amsterdam, 2 March 2014) Dark brown colour, almost black, with foamy beige head. Malty, roasted nose with coffee, chocolate, caramel, rye bread and hints of bourbon. Malty, roasted taste with notes of chocolate, liquorice, caramel, rye bread, lots of oak wood and bourbon, finishing quite sweet with a generous roasty bitterness. Full body with well rounded mouthfeel. Fairly sweet. Quite powerful, but very tasty. Lovely beer!

33cl bottle
Appearance: Very dark brown with a very small white head. Leaving a hint of lacing.
Aroma: chocolate, borbon, wood, cherries, tobaco,rye,roasted malts
Taste: Extremely complex, bourbon notes, chocolate, wood, cherries, tobaco,rye, roasted malts, Starts mild seweet then goes over in a much sweet taste which could be described as a excellant Cherry liquor and bourbon filled chocolsate befor rhe wood kicks in the finish. The aftertaste shows various elements of this taste, which is very nice. Drink it to fast and the alcohol warming and taste shows up drink it slower and the alcohol just boost the palate. So please use this as a sipper.
thick body,lightlly below average carbonation, syrupy mouth feel.

Complexity is huge how much taste can you put in a single bottle. Well a lot according to The Molen/ Närke. The only prolem is it just looks ok. But this is one of the best and most complex beers that I had so far.

Bourbon barrel aged version. 4 ounce draft at ChurchKey poured into a tasting snifter. Pours brownish black with brown hues, off-white head. Aromas of big bourbon, dark fruit, booze. Tasting notes of dark fruit, bourbon, raisins, caramel, syrup. Medium body with a dry finish. Light carbonation, slick mouthfeel.
Bottle from Marcus. Pours black with brown head. Taste is big bourbon heat and roasted malts
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours dark brown with no head. Aroma of leather, cherry and tobacco. Med body. Flavor is aroma plus a little treacle and stone fruit. Delicious.
Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours dark brown with a transient tan head and a fruit and chocolate aroma. There is a rich chocolate and treacle flavor with an oak finish. This is a delicious brew.

Negra con destellos rojizos. Coronada por una pequeña capa de espuma que desaparece rápidamente.
Aromas a barrica, licor y vanilla.
Cuerpo medio y poco gas. 
En boca sedosa, con presencia de la madera, fruta madura y bourbon. El alcohol bastante bien integrado se nota principalmente en la boca del estómago.
Le falta ser más redonda para ser una gran cerveza

2014.03.26 - de Molen Goths and Vandals - on tap at ChurchKey. 

This was several days ago so only general impressions.

Aroma: I am usually weak at aroma, and worse at recalling aroma, but de Molens are often pretty neutral to my nose. 7/10

Appearance: pretty appealing, about what you expect from the style. Moderately dark. 4/5

Taste: All de Molens are exceptionally smooth for the abv, and often so smooth it's hard to differentiate flavors. Suffice it to say it was yummy and I enjoyed orcas expected. 8/10

Palate: As I mentioned I find all de Molens to be exceptionally smooth. Slick mouthfeel. Hard to see room for improvement unless you really need carbonation. 5/5

Overall: another solid effort from de Molen. They clearly take pride in their effort since they typically remind you that you can age most if their stuff for up to 25 years. 16/20

Rated May 4th 2013 at CBC. Pours a medium dark brown with a low head. Aroma is raisins, caramel, toffee, figs, dates, dried fruits. Taste is caramellized apple, raisins, figs, dates, madeira. Quite good!

Bottled. Pours clear dark ruby brown with an average, lacing, beige head. Aroma of toasted malt, caramel, dark fruit and wood. Sweet flavor that ends up with bitter notes and alcohol. Full bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A great ale.

Bottle to snifter. This vintage is 10% and aged in bourbon barrels. Looks good; a mostly opaque dark brown with soft carbonation and light beige head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells sweet and malty with notes of dark fruit, oak, bourbon, and vanilla. Tastes like it smells with some raisin notes that shine through. Caramel too as it warms up. Pleasant on the palate. Good beer!

Bottle at the Jeffrey. Pours like coke with almost no head. Nose is dark fruits and bourbon. Tastes of bourbon, lots of grape, light cola, plums, vanilla, some breadiness, and molasses. Medium bodied and not too sweet. Pleasant.
330ml bottle, barrel aged at 10.6%. Pours very dark brown with a small head. Aroma is sweet bourbon and caramel. Taste has sweet bourbon and toffee with raisins in the finish.

bottle at home, poured a dark brown ruby colour with a non lasting tanned head. sweet sugar, dried red fruits, caramel, bourbon, vanilla, plums, sweet flavour, raisins. some kind of metallic aftertaste. not my thing

Eerste keer dat ik er eentje drink van de molen maar heb er wat ingeslagen.
Deze is heel anders dan dat ik normaal drink. Zeker vol van smaak en gaat echt op de loop met je

10cl sample from tap @ de Molen. Dark brown color, minimal beige head. Aroma coffee, chocolate, rum, roasted malt. Taste medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, sweetish wine-ish finish. Not realy my style, too sweet.
Old malty aroma. Cloudy dark brown with small head. Bitter incoherent short taste. Full bodied, soft texture & average carbonation.

Draft and 33cl bottle sampled in a sniffer. This beer has a beautiful look to it. With a thick 2 finger brownish head on a dark red to black beer, it just screams:"Drink me!". And the taste doesn?t dissappoint either. It has the taste of forest fruits, vanilla and bourbon. The texture is quite thick and the beer goes down smoothly. Very beautiful and enjoyable brew!
Massive beer. Heavy body, with notes of roasted malt and dark fruits. Delicious vanilla taste of the bourbon. Amazing.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized beige to brown colored foamy head on top of what seems to be a black colored beer but when hold close to a light source it has a slight ruby tone that comes through.
Aromas of bourbon, butter, meat, caramel, cream, some vanilla, wood, dried leaves, toast, some bay leaf, marzipan and green grass.
Flavours of bourbon, corn, bitters, vanilla, spices, malts, yeast, wood, herbs, chalk, caramel, alchol drenched peach and prunes, toast, honey, bread, slight alcohol touch and some dried leaf toast.
Aftertaste is bitter, spicy, malty, oatmeal, herbs, wood and yeast.
Low carbo, creamy close to silky mouthfeel, full body and a creamy oily sticky texture.
Aroma is lovely, flavour is good but not perfect.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle from Bierkoning shared with Alan, pours plum color with light head/lace. Notes are Malt, molasses, chocolate, caramel malt, barrel, grape, bronze, and barrel. Medium body. Quad reminiscent. Average

Bottle with thanks to MrH! Pours cloudy mahogany, minimal tan head, some lacing. Aroma is dark sugars, dried fruits, molasses, whiskey, vanilla, oak. Flavor is the same, quite sweet, a bit of bitterness, chocolate, some zestiness. Medium body, creamy, flat as a board.

Bottle @ a recent bottle share (thanks hannont)... Big, full mouthfeel. Creamy and soft on the palate. Nice oak and spirit booze notes. Warming alcohol. Syrupy sweetness, simple syrup, burnt sugars. Viscous all the way through.

Tap at the Brewery. Poured a clear dark brown with a thin off white head. The aroma is creamy malt caramel and alcohol. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a liqourice bitter light marmite palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
Dark brown reddish beer, almost no head. Sweet fruity, malts and alcohol. Siropy and not totally my thing.
Dark brown, orange, with no head. Sweet barley wine aroma and taste, medicinal sirupy. Very sweet aftertaste. High alcohol finish.

Sampled from tap. Dark brown with ruby edges. Dense latte head. Pleasant aroma of dark dried fruits, fortified wine, wood and gently roasted malts. Close to full-bodied. Succulent texture. Healthy malt body with a refined sweetness. Notes of dried fruits, liqueur, oak and rum&raisin. A mild bitterness in long warming finish. A very nice one.
Dark dark brown pour with almost no head. Aroma of bread, prunes, chocolate. Hints of smoke and bourbon. Taste is low in bitterness and heavy on the sweet side. Overall very enjoyable.

33cl bottle @ home. Black colour with a small to medium sized beige head. Smells roasty, lots of chocolate, sweet, praline, vanilla, hint of bourbon, nuts, wood, oak. Tastes red fruits, bourbon, wood, vanilla, chocolate, roasty and a hint of iron. If the iron goes away its lovely. Full body, silky, soft carbo, lovely beer.

After a few sips the iron went away. Love it.

Éjsötét sör, egészen kevés barna, krémes habbal, pörkölt kávés, vaniliás, csokoládés, enyhén gyümölcsös illattal és ízzel. Jó kis sör ez, bár nálam inkább stout, mint belga erős ale, de egye fene, így se rossz.

On tap at Haand Festival. Clear, brown beer with a finger-thick beige head leaving lacings. The aroma has bread, roasted malts and prunes. Its sweet, warming and full-bodied on the palate, pleasant carbonation. Dried fruits, a pleasant bitterness, some bread and roasted malts in the flavor, lasting for a good while. Overall, a tad sweet I think, but its tasteful anyway. Boring aroma though. 130524
Botella. Madera destilado, mantequilla y dulce. Con notas de café pero muy ligeras. Poco cuerpo y muy alcoholica

Pours a pitch black with a minimal head. Aroma of Vanilla and Bourbon. Taste is sweet and medium bitter. In the mouth is sticky, a lot of molasses, chocolate, coffe and booze. I was expecting a little bit more of this two imperial stouts monsters.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown with no head whatsoever. Aroma has lots of dark grains and molasses with backing roasted malts with a touch of underlying rye and booze. Flavor starts with rye and dark grains with booze and a hint of molasses.

Color caoba oscuro con escasa espuma color crema. Aromas de licor, pasas, madera. En boca es densa e intensa de sabor con un inicio dulce, afrutado y licoroso seguido de un amargor tostado  equilibrado e igualmente con toques de alcohol. Muy rica.

very dark, cofee-like colour, half-inch creamy brown head; aroma of vanilla, oak barrel, dried cherry, dark chocolate, some smoke and roasted coffe; taste of heavy roasted malt, chocolate, liqueur, syrup and some alcohol - excellent beer...my only problem is: it is hard to understand how it was categorized here as a belgian strong ale...it is definitely an imperial stout - according to its label, a rye imperial stout...

Pours dark brown, almost no head. Toasty aroma with a hint of smoke. Flavours heavy on vanilla from the bourbon with some toffee in there. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark amber colour, almost no head. Aroma of oak , vanilla, bourbon, anise, molasses. Taste is a bit sour, slightly sweet and bitter. Kinda tangy flavour. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, Interesting but not my favourite.
Notes from backlog. Incredible mouthfeel, lots of molasses, chocolate, bourbon and vanilla.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ as ""Merciless Goths & Vandals"
Dark brown color, small beige head. Toffee and caramel dominates the flavor. Medium to full-bodied. Caramel, maybe hints of wood and hops, quite sweet beer. Need ageing certainly.

14/X/13 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: 28/II/13 (2013-972) 
Clear dark brown beer, small aery off-white to beige irregular head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: alcohol, mocha, coffee, charcoal, chloride, bit yeasty, dairy, is it lactose? MF: quite some carbon, medium to full body. Taste: pretty sour, unburned peat, coffee, some mocha, raisins, dried cranberries, alcohol. Aftertaste: very hoppy, bit sourish, lots of roasted malts, coffee, pretty sweet, alcohol burn in the throat, some vanilla and caramel notes on warming up.

Bottle. Pours darkest Brown/Black with a thin, black coffee tan head. Aroma of heavy, woody bourbon with a mild vanilla. The beer is very full bodied. Amazing thickness and great effect from the barrel aging. Nice thick dryness to finish. Lightly sweet liquorice and roast malt flavours give way to creamy bourbon woodiness. Totally delicious.
Really impressive beer. Thin foam, very dark brown colour. Aroma quite complex, vanilla, oak, malt, hop, fruit, alcohol. Flavour is vanilla, oak, alcohol, malt, hop, fruit. Full body, silk mouth.
Bottle. Aroma of dark fruits, plum, raisin. Very dark colour. Taste is very fine. Alcohol present with honey. Plums, light other fruits. Mostly sweet. Very very good one.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 Bottle from De Molen web shop. Almost black color with small beige head. Aroma of whiskey, rye, dark MALT, vanilla. Taste dark MALT, coffee, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, dried fruit. Alcohol is present but not in disturbing way. Delicious.

Bottle. Courtesy of Cuso. Pours dark brown color, small beige head. Aroma is milk chocolate, coffee, sugar, caramel, white chocolate, alcohol. Taste is milk chocolate, clear alcohol, coffee, caramel, grapes, sweet, hints of bitterness. Nice sweet chocolate finish... Excellent beer.

Dark brown/black with a decent beige head. Aroma is bourbon, dates, fig, booze, caramel. Slightly oily mouthfeel, starts sweet on the palate with a slightly boozy, fruity finish. Taste is dates, raisins, soy sauce, fig, hint of bourbon and oak.

Pours a dark brown with a off-white lacy head. The nose is sour grapes, burnt sugar and sweet tarts. The pallet is sweet tart, bourbon,vanilla, soy sauce, burnt sugar and toffee. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours very dark brown with tan head. Nose and taste of grape, toffee, burnt caramel, oak, port wine, prune, plum, dark fruit, raisin and alcohol. Medium - full bodied. Some alcohol in finish.

On the train from Hereford to Inverness, bottle from the De Molen shop, 18/10/13. 
Dark mahogony brown with a thin light tan swirl of a head.
Nose is oaky boozedom, brown sucre, coconut shavings, dark toffee, light bourbon notes.
Taste is bourbon infused wood, dark toffee fudge, brown sugars, caramelised dark fruit notes, Xmas cake, subtle booze.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, light booze and candy sugars in the last hurrah.
Enjoyable stuff, a fairly complex well balanced affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Black colour, off-white head. Aroma of whisky, wood, hops, stout, light vanilla, roasted malts, caramel and molasses. Roasted malts flavour, quite sweet, brown sugar, light sour note, cork and wood. Finish wood, acacia, cacao, vanilla and red fruits. OK beer.
(From 33cL bottle shared @ Tims place)
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2014 Bottle shared. Pours dark brown to black. Aroma is coffee, bourbon, chocolate and Raisin. Quite sweet and quite bitter. Nice! Full bodied with soft carbonation. Thick texture.

Bouteille 33cl de HopDuvel.
Cuivrée, col moyen blanc cassé.
Arôme est malté avec une pointe daigreur accompagnée de suite par le bourbon. Le tout se marie bien avec un bouquet généreux de grillé et une certaine douceur.
Palais est malté savoureux suivi de bourbon et un léger palais doux relevé par cette pointe épicée de seigle et grains. Notes cara / pâle ainsi que chocolatée restant dans une approche classique euro. Le tout est assez sec, belle pétillance gardant ce profil très DM et pour une fois cette version barrique comble mes attentes. Alcool finit par se ressentir et en fin de bouche je note une petite pointe surette.

33cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. ABV 10.6%, rye imperial stout. Deep dark brown colour, thin beige head. Aroma of lots of bourbon, wood, slight tartness, vanilla, hint of spice, molasses. Flavour is sweet, bourbon, vanilla, bitter wood, touch of tartness, molasses, very light touch of smoke, rye bitter and spiciness, dark fruits, raisins, bourbon finish with some bitterness. Full-bodied, slick. Nice, but very heavy on the bourbon.

Pours dark brown and hazy with almost no head at all. Aroma is wood, whisky, rye, roasted, caramel, vanilla and fruits. Flavour is caramel, medium to heavy sweet, roasted, vanilla, chocolate, whisky and somewhat bitter. The body is full, sticky and soft.

Dunkelbraun, ohne schaum, bourbon im aroma, etwas schokolade, süsslich alloholisch, etwas klebrig im abgang

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Delcious, dark brownish red beer. Almost no head. Tastes of port. Picked it up at de Molens beer store.

My bottle claims only 10.6 % ABV, and moreover, calls itself  Rye Imperial Stout", which is not really Belgian. Smal dark beige head over virtually black beer. Alcohol, spirit barrels; later sweet with vanilla and fresh oak - the stamp of Bourbon; milky. FInally roasted notes start to dominate. Bitter-roasted taste with a lactose flavour and vanilla aroma retronasal. Sweetness lags behind, but finally gives the most lasting impression. Again lactic, alcoholic. Serious alcoholheat, warming, rich MF. Rich impression - but take away the Bourbon barrel, and what remains then? Its supposed to be beer first, no?

zwart zonder kraag
aroma: moutig, zoet, chocolade, toffee, graan, rogge
smaken: redelijk zoet, matig bitter, licht zuur, zeer sterk, sterk moutig, donkere pure chocolade, koffie, rogge
volle body, romig, laag co2, iets van houttonen/weeïg, lichte bourbon, sterke koffie, volle body, romig, vanille
Dark brown, beige foam. Low carbonation. Complex beer, aroma is fruity with notes of marzipan and bourbon. Also a bit vinous. Light bitter finish. Well balanced but a bit too sweet.

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours hazy blackish amber with a creamy brownish beige head that leaves some lacing and trace while dissipating. Smell is sweet, malty and fruity with toasted malts, biscuits, pears, apples, raisins, prunes, vanilla fudge, fresh oak, curacao and sweet dark bread. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter, malty and tiny metallic with toasted malts, biscuits, caramel, apples, pears, fresh oak, vanilla fudge, licorice fudge, sweet dark bread and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is round, tiny fruity tart, tiny sticky sweet and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and tiny fruity tart with sweet dark bread, toasted malts, biscuits, pears, apples, raisins, hay and hints of lemon zest. Quite good

Black. Tan head, but only for a short time, because it fades rapidly. Taste and aroma are mostly bourbon and roasted malts. Whiskey and vanilla are clearly present. Some raisins as well. Full only body. Rather low carbo. Great beer!
beige head that disappears fast with some lacing. cola colour. aroma rye, cloying, alcoholic. taste sweet with aftertaste of vanilla, bourbon. medium body and carbonation.  bottle 33 cl / bd 2-2013

Bottled, dated 28/02/2013, large sample. Slightly hazy dark redbrown color, short off-white head diminishing fast, ending with some small lacing. Aroma of bourbon, wood, red fruit, cookie, biscuit, caramel fudge, vanilla, raisin. Taste has quite some sweetness, soft bitterness. Sirupy thick, creamy bourbon. Some alcohol burn, but it all does fit the picture. Very interesting stuff, hard to put in a style, but bloody damn tasty!

Pours a dark brown beer with a good tan creamy head. Smells coffee chocolate roasty snd burnt. Very nice. Tastes vanilla, coffee and dark chocolate. I like it very much. Medium body, low carbo and a sticky texture.

Aroma: Vanilla, Spirits, hints of coffee.
Appearance: Deep red edges to opaque black middle. Minimal off-white head.
Taste: Sweet bourbon-edged chocolate, moving slowly to a mild coffee. 
Palate: Full, creamy body, slightly oily. Soft carbonation. A full-mouth lasting warm finish.
Overall: A tasty chocolate-coffee strong ale with a strong bourbon aroma and front-end.

33 cl. bottle sampled @ post-GBF 2013 train drink. Courtesy of Kraddel. Bottle states barrel aged but doesnt specify which barrel or bareels were used but I am willing to venture that it was bourbon. Smells a bit hoppy, sweet sticky bourbon, vanilla, chocolate with some liquorish and touch of wood, sweet coffee and fudge. Taste is sweet coffee, chocolate fudge, big bourbon and wood vanilla, small touch of Mon Chéri, vanilla, pleasant touch of liquorish and dash of wood. Slick, easy to drink but less thick than usual body. I am honestly a bit surprised that this is not a RIS. Fun label. This is either De Molen being right on track once again or Närkes awesomeness rubbing off on them. Too bad the idiot spilled most of it on me.
CBC 2013. Pours dark brown redish with a nice tanned head. Aroma is fruity malty a bit vanilla astringent. Flavor is sour bitter very fruity mrzipan caramel raisins.

traindrink ( and spoil) , baught at hopduvel ghent . 
not intence smell . roasted malts and some bourbon 
taste is bitter, coffee, chocolate, roastred malts, good carbo , thick mouthfeel . not too much oak character ( no overkill ! ) , good complexity. awsome label, name, and beer .

Bottle, 08/16/2013. Pours dark brown, thin light tan head dies to hazy swirl on the surface, large-bubbled ring of lacing around the glass. Aroma is rich caramel chocolate fudge, cherry bourbon infusion, vanilla cake, short whiff of dark roast, coffee, in the finish. Taste is dark toffee and syrupy red fruit, vanilla bourbon, dark bitter roast finish, a bit boozy. Thick body,chewy. Nice, decadent.

Bottle @ home... it pours clear dark brown with a small tan head....The aroma is light bourbon, caramel, malts and brown sugar.....The flavor is bourbon, molasses, sweet roasted malt and brown sugar....
At CBC 2013. Hazy dark copper with a small off-white head. Malty aroma of toffee, with notes of dark sugar. Sweet toffee, molasses and dark sugar flavour

Tap sample @ Haand Festival 2013. Deep brown-amber body with a small white head. Aroma is sweet nutty caramel, grains, deep malty tones and hints of coffee. Taste is sweet nuts, caramel, toffee, grains, biscuits, butterscotch and hints of brown sugar and alcohol. Full body, medium carbonation. Feels more like a barley wine than a BSA, but hey - still a nice beer.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2013 33cl bottle, shared with Mathieu87. Bought at Hopduvel Ghent.
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, small stable beige head. NOSE: bourbon, some anise, chocolate. TASTE: chocolate, chocolate and some more chocolate, candy sugar, some caramel, some vanilla, some whiskey.

Expected more for its alcohol %!

Drank again with some age
=> Score adapted a little

Draught @ CBC 2013 [ Yellow Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, DenmarkClear dark red brown colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, dried fruit, woody, light alcoholic. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, alcohol, dried fruit, yeasty, caramel, candy - dark fruit, light woody. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. IMO. a bit to sweet to my liking :D [20130503]

Bottle 33cl from Henrik many thanks. A dark beer with low head, nose is on dark malt, dark chocolate and wood, prune touch. Aroma is on wood and vanilla, sweet caramel and red fruits, toffee, chocolate, very complex, fig, grapes, red vine. Very nice beer

33cl bottle from Menno at Kent BF 2013. Thanks Menno. Deep ruby coloured beer with thick beige head. Bready choc and slightly cognac aroma. Wow, its again, just perfectly drinkable. Its just got great mouthfeel. Cognac/whiskyish aroma. Good in mouth, just lovely in mouth. Some toffee on finish, some sherry/port effect on finish. Its pretty impressive to be honest. Now that is a good barrel aged beer.

Bottle. Deep dark brown color. Caramel, vanilla and bourbon in the aroma. Malty sweet flavor with grapes, vanilla and bourbon. Dried fruit. Alcoholic. Vanilla dominating the boozy aftertaste. Interesting beer, but a bit too sweet to become one of my favorites.
Sample at Haand 2013. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is vanilla, oak, malt, hop, fruit, alcohol. Flavour is vanilla, oak, alcohol, malt, hop, fruit. Full body. Very nice beer.

Bottle @ home, thanks dEnk! Hazy brown pour, thin tan head. Aroma of licorice, roasted malts, vanilla, leather, chocolate, coffee, caramel and spices. Flavor is slightly sweet bourbon, bitter roasted malts, smooth and creamy texture, huge body. Very nice brew.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Bottle @ home. Aroma is huge bourbon, liquorice, roast, molasses and more. Flavour is huge bourbon, vanilla, wood, liquorice, big caramel, earthy molasses, some warming alcohol, herbs, spices and more. Great!

A very dark brown, almost black beer with a weak and brown head. The nose of dark and dried fruits, sweetness, also fresh fruits and berries, strawberries, a nice aroma. Taste is rich, dark fruits, some richness of alcohol, raisins. Strong sweetness is balanced with spices/herbs, herbal bitterness fries the end. Full bodied, low carbonation, smooth. A good, dark fruity beer, but the outward habitus promised even more.

Bottle, courtesy of kermis. Pours a dark brown almost reddish beer with a red hue around the rim. Thin off white head. Aroma of bourbon, caramel and molasses. Flavour is rather sweet, some bourbon notes in there. Balance in this beer is rather poorly, Id expected more from a colab from these two breweries. Decent brew however, but could be far better.
33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with kermis. Thanks.Very thin tan head. Clear deep burgundy pour. Raisins and alcohol in the aftertaste. Nice brew.

Tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013 - Session I. Pours clear, ruby-brown with a tight, tan cream head. Dusty dark and dry fruits in the nose, some cherry, dark bread. Big sweet flavor, moderately boozy, with rich bread, toffee, substantial ripe dark fruits. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Creamy. Warm finish, sugary, more bread, rich dates, figs, vanilla. Great stuff.

Sampled at THE FESTIVAL 2013 in Maine with Andrew, Jay and Kramer. Pours a deep blackish brown body with short beige lacing. Aroma is vanilla, wood, booze, roasted caramel malt and dark rich fruits. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of earthy vanilla, oak, booze, light bready character, hazelnut and chocolate. Very nice Belgian strong.

33cl, at 10.6%Vol, new exclusive Dutch collab. brew Anno 2013, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex brew, spicy/roasted and slightly alcoholic/woody, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, nearly no head, very good brew, yet expensive!
pitch dark, smooth small white to brown head. aroma is roasted malty, slightly sugary, flavor is sugar,y roasted malty,

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown with no head. Aroma is bourbon, dark sugars, caramel, toffee, wood!, flowery, vanilla and overripe fruit. Taste is near heavy sweet and light+ bitter. Body is full, texture is soft and sticky, carbonation is near flat. Finishes hot and alco-sweet. Too sweet I think.

Bottle. Clear hazelnut brown with a tiny off white head. Rum soaked raisins and dark dried fruits, syrup, caramel, bourbon, fruity. Full body, heavy sweet and medium bitter, near flat carbonation. Lots of warming alcohol.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear, reddish brown with a small beige head. Thick, sweet oaky aroma and some overripe fruit. Rich and potent body, rather low in carbonation, sweet overripe fruit, thick syrupy sugars and loads and loads of oak. Heavy alcohol burn. 120713
An oil-slick of a beer, really sweet with overbearing barrel character but traces of really interesting dark fruit lying within. Not a success, moderately disappointing in fact, but not terrible.

330 ml bottle - pours deep brown with a tiny creamy kight marroon brown head. Aroma of nuts, plums, vanilla, malt, honey, maple syrup and some bourbon notes, toffee and caramel. Palate is sweet with a semi-dry bitter finish. Sweet taste of whisky, caramel malts. Yummy!

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2015 330ml bottle. Red glowing dark brown colour with small, frothy, diminishing, off-white head. Aroma has hints of oak, toffee, caramel, a touch of vanilla. Taste is sweet malty, vinous, hints of raisin, again notes of oak, toffee, caramel, and vanilla, additionally some chocolate. Oily, sticky palate - too sweet, maybe too young of course.

Pouring at The Festival in Portland with Kramer, Andrew, and J-Dadmond. Pours a clear brown with a thin white to beige head. Soft wood and sweet chocolate and coffee. Caramel, chocolate, sweet toffee. Warm malt, light alcohol, smooth and warm. Caramelized sugar, toffee.

Tap at Haand Festival 2013, Dark brown, low beige head. Malty and yeasty aroma, with wood, vanilla, fruit. Taste is yeasty too, sweet, with chocolate, candy sugar, alcohol, whisky and soft ice(!). Good bitter and fruity finish

Bottle at the Festival. Pale brown head with red highlights. Absolutely no head. Aroma is an oxidyzed mess with some dark fruits and chocolate. Taste is very malty (didnt bothered to be more precise), light bodied and flat. Very bad.
bottle at the festival in portland. sweet sweet plum. old wet caramel. candy. sugar. too sweet. kind of gross.
4th May 2013CBC. Clear dark amber beer, little pale tan head. Palate is soft and semi dry. Creamy woody malt,a little vanilla. Light touch of bourbon or whisky. Dry airy finish. Tasty!

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2013
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, vanilla, oak, dried fruits, alcohol and coconut. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel, warm, oak and vanilla finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Sampled @ Haand 2013. Dark brown body with a small but dense beige head. Aroma is malt, fruit, light oak and a hint of smoke. Flavor is sweet malty, fruity, pleasant bitterness, vinous and wood. Fine body and long aftertaste with sweet malt and warming alcohol.

Draft @ CBC 2013. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy weak woody dark fruit and caramel aroma. Slightly roasted malty spicy dark fruit and caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy dark fruit finish.

On tap at Haand Festival 2013
Brown, thin tanned head. Smells of coconut, coffee, caramel, toast and toffee. Medium sweet, quite malty, also alot of caramel and toffee. Moderate bitter finish. A strange experience, far away from any expectations

On tap at Haand Festivalen 2013. Pours deep brown with a small creamy head that stays up for a long time. Aroma of bourbon, caramel, cocoa and vanilla. Very nice and complex aroma. Medium to heavy sweetness, medium bitterness, soft carbonation, full body,  long nice creamy finish.

Appearance: Dark and subtle red color with a small tan head.Aroma: Fruity (a bit vinous), malty and mild oak.Palate: Medium body. Slightly sweet and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Sweet vinous fruity, vanilla, malty and oak.Overall impression: Powerful beer, but a bit to sweet for me.Personal stats: Sample @ Haand 13

Sampled from tap at Haandøl 2013. The De Molen people at the stand insisted this beer is called Kristina Goths & Vandals with only one batch made. Black body with a light brown head. Bourbon, vanilla and raisin aromas. Sweet, roasted, alco warm, full bodied, syrupy, more dried fruits.
On tap at Haand 2013. Pours very dark ruby, small tanned head. Aroma of oaked barrel and dark malts. Taste is sweet, lots of vanilla, and all that wood, ok beer, but not quite my cup

Tap @ CBC 2013. The pours deep brown with a small head. The aromas apples, honey, burnt brown sugar. Spicy yeast. The taste is cotton candy sweetness. Candied apple. Belgian yeast. Slightly hot on the finish. Rich, full. Overall, fine.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 25.05.2013, tap @ HaandFestival:
Small slightly brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet and nicely balanced, bourbon, vanilla, cocoa, dark sugar, coconut cream, licorice, oak, caramel. Taste is rich and sweet, dark malts, caramel, vanilla, oak, chocolate, dark sugar, licorice, bourbon, coconut cream, grass, sour coffee. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice!
haandfestivalen . svart oljeaktig ,beige skumrand; kaffe,lakris,sjokolade,malt,mørke frukter

On tap at Haand Beer Festival 2013, Drammen. Barrel Aged. Very dark ruby colour, nearly black. Moderate beige head. Very nice aroma of oaked red wine. Sweet flavour, loads of oaked red wine and sweet sherry, mild toasted malts in the background. Warming mouthfeel. Good beer!
From tap. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and light yeasty. Roasted malty and light yeasty fruity. Thick malty and overripe fruity finish.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, fruit, yeast, chocolate, licorice and brown sugar.
Pours brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasted caramel, fruity yeast and light chocolate. Flavour is roasted caramel, fruity yeast, dark fruit, light sour notes, grass and light citrus.

On tap @CBC13. Hazy dark brown with offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, perfume, little yeast, brown sugar, dark fruits. Flavor is malt, yeast, sweet, chocolate, licorice, brown sugar and alcohol. Really nice

Fra fat på CBC mai-13: vinøs, med mye aroma og smak av sødmefylte, tørkede, syltede frukter og rosiner og overmoden frukt. Noe sjokolade (og vanilje?) også. Så god at det var bra at glasset var så lite. Frister til gjentagelse - må på investeringslista.

Draught at CBC 2013. Clear amber/brown - offwhite head. Fruity, toasted. sweetness, caramel, raisins, nutty, phenolic, alcoholic, dried fruits, light wooden, overripe fruits, light licorice, chocolate, toffee, vanilla, spicy.
Draft. A dark amber beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of alcohol, straw, and fruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, malt, caramel, and alcohol, leading to a dry finish.
On tap at CBC. Black-reddish colour with small dense white head. Malty, vanilla aroma. Sweet, malty aroma, with some vanilla and caramel.
CBC. Hazy dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. Soft and smooth. 030513

Tap @ CBC as "Merciless Goths & Vandals".  Dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is malt, yeast, dark fruits, caramel and toasted. Flavour is malt, yeast, caramel, candy sugar, dark fruits, sweet, oak and toffee.
Sample @ CBC. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are wood, bourbon, vanilla, fruits, caramel, malt and hops.

Draught @ CBC. Pours hazy dark brown with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, brown sugar, dark fruits. Flavor is malt, yeast, sweet, chocolate, licorice, brown sugar, light boozy. Full body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish. 040513

Pours dark brown with low yellow white head
Aromas of chocolate, dark fruits
Great mouthfeel, full bodied, medium sweetness. Very well balanced
Chocolate, belgo yeast.

Sample at CBC 2013, Friday.

Slightly hazy dark brown with a small head. Belgian yeast, oak, dried fruit, toffee and some alcohol. Very sweet, not that balanced.

Pours dark brown with medium frothy white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, leather, barnyard, earth. Some sweet dark fruit as well. Taste is sweet dried fruit and muscovado, very nice! Body is medium and creamy with flat carbonation.

Draught @ CBC 2013: Dark amber coloured. Dark beige dense head. ARoma: Ripe fruits, sweetness, vanilla, caramel, toffee. Flavour: Overipe fruits, spice, caramel, some sweetness, chocolate, toffee. Medium to full bodied. Ends fruity and caramelly. Has a distinct alcoholbite.

Draught at CBC 2013.
Clear orange-red coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits with notes of bourbon.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel and dried fruits.
Sweet and fruity finish.

On tap at CBC, pours a hazy mahogany with a small beige head. Aroma of oak barrels, Belgian yeast, and candied sugar. Flavour is intensely sweet, with loads of candied sugars, Belgian yeast, and caramel. Sickly sweet and cloying. Not complex in any way, with way too sweet a palate. Not so good at all.
Sampled draught at CBC, blue session, Saturday afternoon May 4, 2013.Clear dark brown color, light brown head. Sweet, alcohol scent. Toffee, alcohol, malty taste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness.

Sampled @ CBC 2013. Lightly unclear reddish color, small to medium sized off-white head. Smell and taste malts, lightly yeast, lightly sweet, some alcohol and overripe fruits. Nice. Medium to full body, medium carbonation.
(Short review due to the massive amounts of beer I drank during the CBC13.) Good!

Draught. Clear deep brown liquid with small to medium brown head. Aroma of raw sugar, vanilla, wood, dried fruit, dark fruit, chocolate, toffee and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of toffee, raw sugar and light booze. Medium to full bodied with low to medium carbonation.

Tap at CBC 2013.  Pours dark brown with a beige head.  Aroma of vanilla, caramel, chocolate, biscuit, roasted malt and dark fruit.  Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate bitter.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Draught at CBC 2013. Black beer with a small but lasting beige head. Woody vanilla aroma, caramel, chocolate, roasted, biscuits, bready, fruity, har, spicy notes. Vanilla flavor, oak, caramel, chocolate, hazelnuts, sweetish, warming alcohol, prunes, figs, citrus, warming alcohol.

Sample @ CBC13.
Pours clear dark red color with a small head. Aroma of sweet sugary fruits and ..nothing else. Flavour of caramel, ripe fruits and lots of sugar. Way too sweet.
7223

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours a brown colour without a head. Aroma of sweet sugary malts, burnt bread and hay. Flavour of bready malts, residual sugar, caramel, chocolate, burnt bread and grassy hops. Medium bodied, oily mouthfeel and a sugary malty finish. Messy.

Draught @ CBC 2013
Pours reddish brown with a small white head. Aroma of sweet oaky malts, wood and syrup. Taste is sweet, sticky, malty and wooden with oaky notes and hints of syrup. Finish is oaky and malty with vanilla, cream and sticky sweet notes. Quite sweet and malty belgian ale.
